images.description: Two years ago, I saw a really cute guy on a Me Monday thread. Much to my surprise, he only lived two hours away from me! I was intimidated, but somehow worked up the courage to say, "Wow, you're really cute!" not really thinking much of it.

I just knew I had to find a way to meet this guy. Not possessing the ability to be assertive and direct, I decided to create an Arizona gaybros group in hopes that I could plan a meetup with everyone and he would attend. We started Facebook chatting some and I was starting to like him more and more each day. Unfortunately, he bailed for the meetup at the last minute with no explanation. I thought it was game over.

Fast forward a few months, I receive a message from him that he'd stopped talking because he knew we lived in different cities and thought it would be too difficult, and he'd started dating somebody else, but it didn't work out.

I was still very much smitten by him, so I decided to see where it would go. We talked every day and eventually planned a weekend for him to come down to my city. I can't even describe the nerves I had when I saw his car round the corner for the first time. How could I be so stupid to invite a stranger living two hours away to my apartment for an entire weekend? That's how people get murdered and dumped in the desert, Jeff!

That was one of the best weekends I've ever experienced. We had so much to talk about and just had a blast together! We talked and neither one of us wanted a long distance relationship (especially knowing he was moving out of state in three and a half months), but we knew we had a good thing and didn't want to let it slip away.

The next three and a half months were spent with us taking turns traveling back and forth to see one another. We'd only get to spend a few days together here and there, but they were always so good. Moving day for him came much sooner than we would have liked, and we came to a crossroad.

Instead of being 2 hours apart, we were about to be 29 hours apart. How were we supposed to make that work? Was it even worth it? Neither one of us had felt this way before, so we decided to at least give it a shot. Car rides turned to plane trips, and instead of being able to see each other every weekend, it became about once a month that we'd get to spend a few days together. It was incredibly tough, but love always finds a way.

After 7 months of living multiple states apart, we decided to make a huge leap of faith. I was a little more relocatable, so I decided to move to be with him. I had never lived in a city away from my family, one where I only would know one person, so I was terrified.

I moved here five months ago and can say it has been the best decision of my life. It's tough being away from my family and friends, but I've made several new friends already and get to be with the man I love.
Tonight, I asked that man to share his life with me.

Here is us having after a celebratory dinner at the boathouse in the park. I'm looking forward to a lifetime of love and joy with the most incredible man I have ever met. 

Thanks, /r/gaybros, for introducing me to the man of my dreams!

EDIT: I did NOT expect this to blow up. Went to bed thinking I'd get a few warm wishes, woke up to the front pages of Reddit and Imgur. Thank you all so much for the kind (and sometimes funny) words! For those asking, Me Monday is a theme day on the gaybros subreddit where people can post short introductions and get to know one another. It really promotes the community vibe and can have some positive outcomes!
